solution_line_template: A size {ad_length} foot by {ad_width}-foot rectangle ad takes {ad_length}*{ad_width} = <<{ad_length}*{ad_width}={ad_area}>>{ad_area} square feet since the area of a rectangle is l*w.

If each company bought {num_ad_spaces_per_company} ad spaces, the total area that their ads took is {ad_area}*{num_ad_spaces_per_company} = <<{ad_area}*{num_ad_spaces_per_company}={total_area_per_company}>>{total_area_per_company} square feet.

If each square foot of ad space was charged at ${cost_per_sq_ft}, {total_area_per_company} square feet of ads cost ${cost_per_sq_ft}*{total_area_per_company} = $<<{cost_per_sq_ft}*{total_area_per_company}={cost_per_company}>>{cost_per_company}

If all three companies each purchased an equal number of ad space, together they paid ${cost_per_company}*{num_companies} = $<<{cost_per_company}*{num_companies}={total_cost_combined}>>{total_cost_combined}
